info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 29 at 11:29AM CDT until June 29 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN HENDERSON...NORTHWESTERN WARREN...SOUTHWESTERN ROCK ISLAND...MERCER...NORTHEASTERN DES MOINES...CENTRAL LOUISA AND SOUTHERN MUSCATINE COUNTIES... At 1129 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Muscatine to Joy to Oquawka, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Muscatine, Aledo, Oquawka, Burgess, Andalusia, Fruitland, Viola, Millersburg, Matherville, New Boston, Keithsburg, Grandview, Reynolds, Conesville, Eliza, Joy, Letts, Little York, Rozetta and Seaton. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
